29 September 1958
CABLE ADDRESS INTERFAX
UNITED NATIONS PLAZA AT 46TH STREET
NEW YORK 17. NEW YORK
Dear Mr. Underwood:
Under the auspices of the Church Peace Union, I have produced a
series of three complete half-hour dramatic radio programs. The purposes
of these programs called A TIME TO REMEMBER is to use the medium of true
personal dramas to influence the general public in applying the common teachings
of the world's great religions as set forth in the enclosed pamphlet.
The completed programs are based on the lives of Carl Sandburg,
Danny Kaye and Justice William C. Douglas. At the end of each program, the
protagonist comments on the impact his experience had in his life and the wisdom
to be derived from it. The necessary clearances have been obtained in all cases.
The Church Peace Union believes these programs far surpass the
average dramatic radio program in listener appeal as well as quality and are
eminently suited for broadcast by the NAEB network. I am therefore enclosing
the scripts of these programs for your consideration.
The Church Peace Union will offer these programs without cost for
distribution by NAEB. If you are interested, I will forward the tapes to your
office.
Any consideration you may give to this proposal will be very much
appreciated.
Director of Public Relations
Mr. Robert E. Underwood, Jr.
Network Manager
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
